DOC.brief_summary: Animal, in vitro and small-scale studies have suggested that creatine supplementation may augment bone mass. This clinical trial aims to investigate the effects of a 2-year creatine supplementation protocol on bone mass in postmenopausal women.
DOC.brief_title: Creatine on Bone Mass in Postmenopausal Women
DOC.criteria: healthy postmenopausal women Tscore at lumbar spine, or femoral neck or total femur of between 1SD and 2.5SD drugs or dietary supplements that may affect bone metabolism (e.g., bisphosphonates, AINEs, hormone replacement therapy, calcium, vitamin D, creatine supplementation) low BMI (< 18.5 Kg/m2).
